Diverse notifications

With different notification media, you can get updates however you want them: over email, irc, or pushed to your phone. We would send them to you via carrier pigeon if we could.

One place

...a single place for end-users to manage notification preferences. Instead of having to tweak preferences in bodhi, koji, pkgdb, etc.. you can choose what you do and don't want to receive right here.

Ultimately, simpler

...a single place for email code to live, instead of being duplicated in every new fedoraproject.org application that we write and deploy. This will ostensibly reduce the amount of code that the infrastructure team has to maintain.

fmn

This is a system for managing end-user notifications powered by fedmsg, the Fedora's FEDerated MeSsaGe bus.

With Fedora's fedmsg notifications (FMN), you can receive the message you want how you want them.

email

We all get too much email. You probably don't want any more email. I'm so sorry..

We can help! This application is an attempt at a robust filtering system, built so you can avoid receiving 2000 emails from the pkgdb about stuff you already know.

irc

We have a bot on the freenode network that can direct message you with notifications you care about. Simply login, confirm your IRC nick, set up some filters, and wait for the magic.

android

Push-notifications to your mobile device. You'll need to install Fedora Mobile on your phone for this wiz-biz to fly.
